name: Megan Clark
bio:
I am a graduate from the University of California, Santa Barbara where I received a Bachelor of Arts in Communication. I have extensive experience in event planning, working in teams, and customer service and I hope to pursue event planning or set design as my career long-term. I currently work at the prop house on the NBCUniversal backlot in the warehouse, where I am right in the middle of the action of television and feature film set dressing. I held the position of Reservations and Events Coordinator at UCSB Campus Conference Services and Vice President of Internal Affairs for my school's chapter of Alpha Kappa Psi, one of the professional coed business fraternities on campus. I have enjoyed planning events and interior design throughout my life for more than a decade. Seeing everything come together after arranging each aspect separately is one of the most rewarding feelings I can think of. For this reason, I am passionate about being a part of a workplace with a clear larger vision.

name: Nicole Magaddino (Simonian), CPA
bio:
Is your Finance/Accounting infrastructure growing and you have limited time to devote to hiring? Are you prepared to attract the right Finance/Accounting professionals against others who are hiring in your market who may already have a robust hiring process?
The Bay Area hiring landscape is a competitive one. When you find yourself looking to hire ideally it is because you are being proactive in assessing your growth and infrastructure; however, many times it is often “I needed someone to start yesterday”. There is an absolute appreciation of having a strong due diligence process, but it will be imperative for this process to be effective and efficient.
A strong recruiting partner who (i) understands the marketplace (ii) is experienced in maneuvering through this complex landscape, (iii) is strategic and nimble, (iv) has a strong network of professionals, and (v) who has been in your shoes is imperative.
What led me into this field? At the point of receiving my CPA and rounding out nearly 5 years of public accounting I reflected on what I enjoyed most. It was a quick and clear answer - client services, relationship building, and understanding the needs of a business. I then turned to a recruiter to assist in my next career move. I spoke with a variety of recruiters and those who positively stood out were not necessarily the ones who placed me, but the ones who listened to my desires and needs.
Thus, the joy of being strategic with my clients coupled with curiosity on how to stand out in this market...I ventured into this field. 17 years later I enjoy it more today than ever and being known as a market leader is the icing.
I have won awards throughout my career, such as a Chairman’s award ranking me #7 in the world, but the reward of a successful search continues to drive me today.
Propel Recruitment is a boutique firm specializing in Finance/Accounting recruitment and staffing (both temp and perm).
Let’s connect on how we can bring value to this partnership! Call me today at (650) 291-0430 or email me at nicole.magaddino@propelrecruitment.com
Look forward to hearing from you.
…see more
